title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 19 November 2012 - XWiki
content:
<vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
00:43 <vmassol> has quit

08:03 <coud> has quit

08:08 <coud> has quit  
08:09 <coud> has joined #xwiki  
08:10 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
08:14 <coud> has quit  
08:15 <coud> has joined #xwiki  
08:32 <coud> has quit  
08:38 <vmassol> good morning  
08:45 <Inge-> morning  
08:45 <Inge-> I realize that wrapping everything in a cache macro isn't much fun, since it makes it impossible to edit text in WYSIWYG mode.  
08:46 <jvelo> goo morning  
08:54 <vmassol> Inge-: indeed  
08:54 <vmassol> you have another option  
08:55 <vmassol> it's called rendering cache  
08:55 <vmassol> Inge-: see http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/Performances#HRenderingcache  
09:09 <jvelo\_> has joined #xwiki  
09:12 <jvelo> has quit  
09:12 <jvelo\_> is now known as <jvelo>  
09:13 <Inge-> thanks! I'll check it out  
09:13 <Inge-> there should also be a way for me to "always wrap code macros in cache macros" but I am not sure where to start. Can I call a friend? Ask the audience?  
09:17 <Inge-> Will rendering cache be invalidated when a page is edited?  
09:17 <vmassol> Inge-: "always wrap code macros in cache macros", for this you could create your own wiki macro that does it  
09:17 <vmassol> (it's 3 lines of scripts)  
09:17 <Inge-> I've heard flying is easy - for those who know how :)  
09:17 <vmassol> there's a tutorial  
09:18 <vmassol> !search wiki macro  
09:18 <vmassol> hmm no there  
09:18 <vmassol> here: http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/DevGuide/WikiMacroTutorial  
09:18 <Inge-> google is my friend  
09:18 <vmassol> now  
09:18 <SvenDowideit> has quit  
09:18 <SvenDowideit> has joined #xwiki  
09:19 <vmassol> you could open a jira issue to add support for caching directly in the code macro (not sure it would be accepted but it's a valid request). Or ask on the mailing list  
09:19 <Inge-> thanks. Googling for xwiki macro tutorial came up with this one: http://rendering.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/ExtendingMacro  
09:19 <vmassol> (I also googled)  
09:19 <vmassol> ;)  
09:19 <vmassol> (googled for "xwiki wiki macro")  
09:19 <Inge-> google is scary good. usually faster than site-specific searches, and often more relevant.  
09:20 <vmassol> yeah  
09:20 <Inge-> I use it all the time in preference to the search bar in Microsoft's MSDN site :)  
09:20 <vmassol> your use case is valid and I think code macros should be cached by default  
09:20 <vmassol> so you should create a jira issue for it  
09:21 <Inge-> Yeah, you guys did discuss it in here some weeks back.  
09:30 <jvdrean> has joined #xwiki  
09:32 <Inge-> vmassol: I'm a little worried I'll put it in the wrong place. This is my first ever jira bug report :). Issue Type I guess is improvement, priority minor. What about Project? Xwiki rendering? XWiki platform?  
09:35 <vmassol> 2 seconds, checking  
09:35 <vmassol> ah yes that's the issue when implementing it ;)  
09:36 <vmassol> so it's rendering  
09:36 <vmassol> component = code macro  
09:36 <vmassol> type and severity are ok  
09:36 <vmassol> (the issue when implementing it is that the cache module is currently in platform)  
09:36 <vmassol> (but we can handle that)  
09:36 <vmassol> (cache module should be in commons IMO)  
09:38 <crocket> vmassol, Have you checked https://project.snowberry.me/programs/projects/xwikiobjectsort ?  
09:40 <Inge-> vmassol: thanks. Issue created: http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XRENDERING-253  
09:40 <crocket> I think it could go into xwiki-platform-oldcore.  
09:40 <vmassol> Inge-: thanks  
09:59 <sburjan> has joined #xwiki  
10:07 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
10:09 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
10:33 <sburjan> Hello. When is 4.3 final to be released ?  
10:34 <vmassol> sburjan: hi, http://enterprise.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/Roadmap  
10:35 <sburjan> thanks. I missewd that. I only saw 19th striken over  
10:35 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
10:40 <jvelo> Is it me or the delay after pushing the files to ow2 is really long ?  
10:40 <vmassol> I think it takes a while indeed  
10:40 <jvelo> it's been a couple of hours I've run the push script and they still don't appear  
10:40 <vmassol> ah couple of hours is long indeed  
10:40 <jvelo> like 2 hours  
10:40 <vmassol> I don't have much experience though  
10:40 <vmassol> mflorea and tmortagne might know better  
10:41 <jvelo> the upload was successful as far as the command line output shows  
10:41 <mflorea> 2h is too long indeed  
10:41 <jvelo> anyone knows what happens in the background ?  
10:42 <mflorea> unless there is a problem on their side  
10:42 <jvelo> like do someone from ow2 needs to do something  
10:42 <jvelo> or is it automated on their side too ?  
10:42 <mflorea> I don't know  
10:42 <jvelo> BTW guys if you want to add up to 4.3RC1 RN  
10:43 <jvelo> since it's mostly bug fixes, the RN is quite minimal  
10:43 <vmassol> yeah it's kind of empty but OTOH we only had a few days  
10:43 <vmassol> I was thinking aobut using the JIRA macro  
10:43 <jvelo> yes I thought about that  
10:43 <jvelo> since it's only 19 jiras  
10:49 <jvelo> my bad for OW2, forgot a step  
10:50 <vmassol> guys we're not in a very good shape on functional tests  
10:50 <vmassol> http://ci.xwiki.org/view/Functional%20Tests/  
10:50 <vmassol> we need to stabilize for 4.3 final  
10:50 <vmassol> would be good that all devs focus on that for the 4.3 release in 2 days  
10:51 <jvelo> vmassol: could you update wikimatrix for me ?  
10:59 <Slashman> has quit  
11:01 <vmassol> jvelo: doing it  
11:02 <jvelo> thank you  
11:03 <jvelo> anyone knows why we create a PURL url just for twitter ?  
11:03 <jvelo> I don't really understand the rationale  
11:03 <vmassol> jvelo: done  
11:03 <jvelo> we could use it for all URLs in mails, etc.  
11:03 <jvelo> thanks  
11:03 <vmassol> yes  
11:07 <sburjan> If I'm migrating from a 2.7.2, shouldn't DW to kick in on a 4.3-RC1 ? (I'm on MySQL)  
11:07 <vmassol> yes it should  
11:07 <vmassol> (AFAIU)  
11:08 <sburjan> vmassol: my bad. when using the Jetty+hsqldb backage, you already have an data/extension dir, this is why it doesn't kick in  
11:08 <jvelo> 4.3-rc-1 release done, except maven central  
11:08 <vmassol> sburjan: if you update the WAR it hsould still kick in  
11:09 <vmassol> (check your status file maybe)  
11:09 <sburjan> vmassol: I just shut down the 2.7.2 instance, and start the 4.3-rc1 instance.  
11:09 <sburjan> both are jetty+hsqldb modified to use MySQL  
11:09 <sburjan> status file ?  
11:11 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
11:17 <sburjan> still a lot of merge conflicts when migrating  
11:19 <vmassol> yep that issue is not closed  
11:19 <vmassol> unfortunately  
11:21 <sburjan> the only bad thing is that users will start pressing "continue" button mechanically, and he might overwrite pages which shouldn't be overwritten, like Rights, Groups, etc :)  
11:21 <sburjan> if you're on prod you need to be extra careful not to rush with this  
11:32 <thomasd> has joined #xwiki  
11:37 <Slashman> has quit  
11:38 <sburjan> hmm.. it seems that imported XAR's after migration are lost. Need to investigate, this might be serious  
11:47 <mflorea> has quit  
11:49 <thomasd> Hello, I'm working on the issue "Automatically register translations for the Bulletin Board application", could someone tell me how I can access to the Bulletin Board Application code and how I can modify it ?  
11:51 <vmassol> thomasd: hi  
11:51 <vmassol> it's a contrib project  
11:52 <vmassol> contrib projects are documented here: http://contrib.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/WebHome  
11:52 <vmassol> you'll see a link to github  
11:54 <thomasd> Ok, thanks  
11:55 <sburjan> we should start fixing the blockers we have so we can release on the agreed date  
11:59 <vmassol> fyi I've just updtaed http://jira.xwiki.org/secure/Dashboard.jspa?selectPageId=11198  
12:00 <vmassol> remaining issues currently scheduled: http://jira.xwiki.org/secure/IssueNavigator.jspa?reset=true&jqlQuery=Project+in+%28%22XWiki+Commons%22%2C+%22XWiki+Rendering%22%2C+%22XWiki+Platform%22%2C+%22XWiki+Enterprise%22%2C+%22XWiki+Enterprise+Manager%22%29+and+fixVersion+in+%28%224.3-milestone-1%22%2C+%224.3-milestone-2%22%2C+%224.3-rc-1%22%2C+%224.3%22%29+and+resolution+in+%28Unresolved%29  
12:01 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
12:01 <vmassol> so mostly oracle  
12:01 <vmassol> we need to decide if we do it and more importantly if someone is available to work on that  
12:02 <vmassol> all others should work on fixing functional tests  
12:10 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
12:10 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
12:14 <sburjan> well since we advertize Oracle as being supported we should fix them  
12:16 <thomasd> vmassol : I just tried to send an email to [[email protected]](https://dev.xwiki.org/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection) in order to ask for an access to the Bulletin Board Application code on GitHub, but I received an email telling me that I haven't the rigth to send such a message. Is there something peticular I should do ?  
12:17 <Enygma`> thomasd: http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Community/MailingLists  
12:21 <thomasd> Ok, thanks !  
12:45 <vmassol> nice quote that I knew and that someone just tweeted:  
12:45 <vmassol> "Always code as if the guy who ends up maintaining your code will be a violent psychopath who knows where you live.”  
13:04 <jvelo> has quit  
13:26 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
14:21 <vmassol> tmortagne: we'll need to work on http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XRENDERING-255 so that mflorea can implement better support in the WYSIWYG editor for macro edition  
14:50 <mrvanes> has joined #xwiki  
14:52 <vmassol> did you notice how the new IRC bot app catches XAR import? :)  
14:52 <vmassol> (without spamming the channel)  
14:53 <vmassol> seems sergiu is playing with functional tests in the wiki: http://playground.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Test/WebHome ;)  
14:54 <vmassol> ah no  
14:54 <vmassol> passing tests for developers  
15:12 <tmortagne> vmassol: yes,  need to work on XRENDERING-255 especially since it's not very hard  
15:14 <vmassol> tmortagne: http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Extension+Module  
15:14 <vmassol> is empty....  
15:15 <tmortagne> vmassol: seems to be an issue with the sheet  
15:15 <vmassol> oh thats worse  
15:15 <vmassol> everything is empty :)  
15:15 <tmortagne> someone broke it somway  
15:15 <tmortagne> someway  
15:15 <tmortagne> or maybe someone is playing with it  
15:15 <tmortagne> we would see message here actually  
15:15 <tmortagne> so looks like the sheet is broken for some reason  
15:15 <vmassol> I don't see any change from http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/AllDocs#|t=alldocs&p=1&l=15&s=doc.date&d=desc  
15:16 <vmassol> last change was 2 days ago  
15:16 <vmassol> bad state?  
15:16 <tmortagne> probably, checking log  
15:22 <tmortagne> lots of java.lang.NullPointerException around REST but noting related to the extensions sheet issue  
15:22 <tmortagne> I can can think of is trying to restart
